CatDescriptText: Mrs. Estelle Reid, department store worker and mother, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: I don't see why they should oppose such a tax increase. If they want better schools for their children, they have to realize that it will cost money.  However, I think that they, the average person, would oppose a tax increase."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Estelle Reid, wearing light colored button down collared coat and dark head scarf, standing in front of grocery store window with sale signs including "Bacon 49 cents lb", "pure lard 19 cents lb", "spare ribs 49 cents lb", fresh fish 39 cents lb", and  "Wilson's Chitterlings"
